title: Python Math & ML Course
text:
Discrete Math

Sets, set operations
Decart product
Induction
Functions, function properties
Image, Preimage, Even, Odd, Inverse
Mappings (injective, surjective, bijective)
Permutations, Arrangements
Inclusion exclusion principle
Recursent relations
Somewhere inequalities - Jensen, Cauchy
crumbs: 1¬† Python, Math, Machine Learning Course

title: Python Math & ML Course
text:
üßÆ Linear Algebra

Vectors, vector operations, dot product, norm
Norm (L1, L2)
Angle between vectors
Vector spaces and subspaces
Matrices, matrix operations
Geometric interpretation of matrices
Row echelon form (perhaps won‚Äôt be covered)
Determinant in 2x2 and 3x3 cases, trace
Determinant in general case
Systems of linear equations (perhaps won‚Äôt be covered)
Gauss-Jordan elimination (perhaps won‚Äôt be covered)
Inverse matrix
Linear independence
Basis, rank, dimension
Change of basis
Eigenvalues and eigenvectors
Gram‚ÄìSchmidt algorithm (orthogonalization)
Positive/negative definite matrices
Decompositions (eigen for sure, maybe also SVD/QR/Cholesky)
Matrix norms (at some point)

title: Python Math & ML Course
text:
üìà Calculus

Limit of sequence and function
Continuity
Derivative
Chain rule, product rule, quotient rule
Convexity, concavity
Extrema of a function
Taylor polynomials
Indefinite integral, definite integral

Multivar

Partial derivative
Jacobian, Jacobian matrix
Gradient,
Directional derivative
Hessian
Taylor expansion in several variables
Cauchy-Schwarz inequality
Jensen‚Äôs inequality

crumbs: 1¬† Python, Math, Machine Learning Course

title: Python Math & ML Course
text:
‚õ∞Ô∏è Optimization

AdaGrad / RMSProp / ADAM
Coordinate descent
Second order methods

Derivative-free optimization (Nelder-Mead)
Evolutionary algorithms (Genetic algorithms, CMA-ES)
Bayesian optimization (Surrogate models, Acquisition functions)
Multicriteria optimization (Pareto front, Dominance)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 1: Sample Problem
This is a sample problem with 3 cheese emojis.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 1: Divisibility via inclusion‚Äìexclusion
Count the integers in ({1,,100}) divisible by (5) or (7). Show the inclusion‚Äìexclusion steps.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 2: Two-annotator inclusion‚Äìexclusion
Out of 1,000 images, annotator (R) flags 260 as ‚Äúcat,‚Äù annotator (S) flags 310 as ‚Äúcat,‚Äù and both flag 190.
a) How many images at least one annotator called ‚Äúcat‚Äù?
b) How many images neither annotator called ‚Äúcat‚Äù?

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 3: Inclusion‚Äìexclusion for surjections
Count surjective functions (f:{1,2,3,4}{a,b,c}) using inclusion‚Äìexclusion. Show your work.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 4: Armenian car plates
State your assumptions about the plate format (e.g., LL DDD LL, letters A‚ÄìZ, digits 0‚Äì9, repetition allowed).
a) Under your stated format, how many distinct plates exist?
b) How does the answer change if letters cannot repeat inside the same plate?

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 5: Augmentation pipeline counting
An image pipeline does: random crop (3 sizes), color jitter (on/off), horizontal flip (on/off), and chooses one of 4 background textures.
Assuming independence, how many distinct augmentation ‚Äúrecipes‚Äù can be produced for a given image?

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 6: Two hyperparameters ‚Äî combinations
Let hyperparameter set (H_1) have (m) options and (H_2) have (n) options.
a) How many ((H_1,H_2)) combinations are in a full grid search?
b) Give a concrete example (e.g., (H_1={,}), (H_2={10{-3},10{-4},10^{-5}})) and compute the count.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 7: Anagrams of ‚Äúcheese‚Äù
How many distinct words can you form by rearranging the letters of ‚Äúcheese‚Äù? (Handle repeated letters carefully.)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 8: Train/Test leakage
You collected 200 images. Train set (T) has 140 indices; Test set (S) has 40. A QA script flags overlap (|TS|=4).
a) Are the splits disjoint? If not, how many unique images actually exist across both sets?
b) How many items must be moved to make (T) and (S) disjoint with target sizes (140) and (40) (no duplicates)? Propose a minimal-move strategy.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 9: Real-world examples
Give one real example (and short justification) for each:
- Injective (one-to-one, not necessarily onto)
- Surjective (onto, not necessarily one-to-one)
- Bijective (one-to-one and onto)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 10: Counting small functions
How many functions (f:{1,2,3}{a,b})?
How many are injective? How many are surjective? (Hint: total is (2^3).)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 11: Even/odd ‚Äî activation symmetry
Classify each as even, odd, or neither, and briefly note the symmetry implication:
- (f(x)=x^2) (parabola)
- (g(x)=x^3)
- (h(x)=(x))
- (p(x)=(x)=(0,x))

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
Problem 12: Both even and odd
Describe all functions (f:) that are simultaneously even and odd. Prove your claim.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
01: Train/Test leakage
You collected 200 images. Train set \(T\) has 140 indices; Test set \(S\) has 40. A QA script flags overlap \(|T\cap S|=4\).

Are the splits disjoint? If not, how many unique images actually exist across both sets?
How many items must be moved to make \(T\) and \(S\) disjoint with target sizes \(140\) and \(40\) (no duplicates)? Propose a minimal-move strategy.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
02: Two-annotator inclusion‚Äìexclusion
Out of 1,000 images, annotator \(R\) flags 260 as ‚Äúcat,‚Äù annotator \(S\) flags 310 as ‚Äúcat,‚Äù and both flag 190.

How many images at least one annotator called ‚Äúcat‚Äù?
How many images neither annotator called ‚Äúcat‚Äù?

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
05: Augmentation pipeline counting
An image pipeline does: random crop (3 sizes), color jitter (on/off), horizontal flip (on/off), and chooses one of 4 background textures.
Assuming independence, how many distinct augmentation ‚Äúrecipes‚Äù can be produced for a given image?

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
06: Two hyperparameters ‚Äî combinations
Let hyperparameter set \(H_1\) have \(m\) options and \(H_2\) have \(n\) options.

How many \((H_1,H_2)\) combinations are in a full grid search?
Give a concrete example (e.g., \(H_1=\{\text{Adam},\text{SGD}\}\), \(H_2=\{10^{-3},10^{-4},10^{-5}\}\)) and compute the count.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
03: Divisibility via inclusion‚Äìexclusion
Count the integers in \({1,\dots,100}\) divisible by \(5\) or \(7\). Show the inclusion‚Äìexclusion steps.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
07: Armenian car plates
State your assumptions about the plate format (e.g., DD LL DDD, digits 0‚Äì9, letters A‚ÄìZ, repetition allowed).

Under your stated format, how many distinct plates exist?
How does the answer change if letters cannot repeat inside the same plate?

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
08: Anagrams of ‚Äúcheese‚Äù
How many distinct words can you form by rearranging the letters of ‚Äúcheese‚Äù? (Handle repeated letters carefully.)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
04: Inclusion‚Äìexclusion for surjections
Count surjective functions \(f:\{1,2,3,4\}\to\{a,b,c\}\) using inclusion‚Äìexclusion. Show your work.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
09: Real-world examples
Give one real example (and short justification) for each:

Injective (one-to-one, not necessarily onto)
Surjective (onto, not necessarily one-to-one)
Bijective (one-to-one and onto)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
10: Counting small functions
How many functions \(f:\{1,2,3\}\to\{a,b\}\)?
How many are injective? How many are surjective? (Hint: total is \(2^3\).)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
11: Even/odd ‚Äî activation symmetry
Classify each as even, odd, or neither, and briefly note the symmetry implication:

\(f(x)=x^2\) (parabola)
\(g(x)=x^3\)
\(h(x)=\tanh(x)\)
\(p(x)=\mathrm{ReLU}(x)=\max(0,x)\)

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
12: Function properties
Given \(f(x)=x+3x^2\), determine:

Is it injective or not?
Is it surjective or not?
Is it bijective or not?
What is the image of \(A\) under \(f\), when \(A=[-1,2]\)?
What is the preimage of \(B\) under \(f\), when \(B=[0,5]\)?

Briefly justify each answer.

title: HW 00: Sets, Combinatorics, Functions
text:
13: Both even and odd
Describe all functions \(f:\mathbb{R}\to\mathbb{R}\) that are simultaneously even and odd. Prove your claim.
